      • cards

        private java.util.ArrayList<Card> cards
        The ArrayList of Card objects wrapped by this pile. This is a reference to a mutable object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Pile

        public Pile()
        Constructs a new pile containing an empty ArrayList.

      • Pile

        public Pile(java.util.Collection<Card> collection)
        Constructs a new pile containing the specified Collection of Card objects. The specified collection is stored as an ArrayList in this pile.
        Parameters:
        collection - - the collection of cards to be wrapped by this pile
        See Also:
        Card

    • Method Detail

      • wrapIndex

        private int wrapIndex(int index,
                      boolean useSize)
        Returns the most relevant index within the bounds of this pile, inclusive. Returns 0 if the size of this pile is 0.

        An index already within the bounds of this pile is left unchanged. An index greater than or equal to the size of this pile returns the upper bound. An index less than or equal to the negative of the size of this pile returns 0. Any other negative index returns the sum of the size of this pile and itself.

        Parameters:
        index - - the index to be placed within the bounds of this pile
        useSize - - whether to use the size of this pile as its upper bound
        Returns:
        the most relevant index within the bounds of this pile, inclusive

      • addCard

        public int addCard(Card card)
        Places the specified card on top of this pile.
        Parameters:
        card - - card to be added
        Returns:
        the new size of this pile

      • addCardAt

        public int addCardAt(int index,
                     Card card)
        Inserts the specified card at the specified position in this pile. Pushes the card currently at that position (if any) and any cards above it towards the top of this pile (adds 1 to their indices).

        An index greater than or equal to the size of this pile causes the card to be placed on top. An index less than or equal to the negative of the size of this pile causes the card to be placed on the bottom. Any other negative index specifies the position from the top of this pile.

        Parameters:
        index - - index at which the specified card is to be inserted
        card - - card to be inserted
        Returns:
        the new size of this pile
        See Also:
        wrapIndex(int, boolean)

      • addCards

        public int addCards(java.util.Collection<Card> collection)
        Places the cards in the specified collection on top of this pile.
        Parameters:
        collection - - collection containing cards to be added to this pile
        Returns:
        the new size of this pile

      • addCardsAt

        public int addCardsAt(int index,
                      java.util.Collection<Card> collection)
        Inserts the cards in the specified collection at the specified position in this pile. Pushes the cards currently at that position (if any) and any cards above them towards the top of this pile (increases their indices).

        An index greater than or equal to the size of this pile causes the cards to be placed on top. An index less than or equal to the negative of the size of this pile causes the cards to be placed on the bottom. Any other negative index specifies the position from the top of this pile.

        Parameters:
        index - - index at which the first card from the specified collection is to be inserted
        collection - - collection containing cards to be inserted
        Returns:
        the new size of this pile
        See Also:
        wrapIndex(int, boolean)

        public boolean containsCard(Card card)
        Returns true if this pile contains the specified card.
        Parameters:
        card - - card whose presence in this pile is to be tested
        Returns:
        true if this pile contains the specified card

      • containsCards

        public boolean containsCards(java.util.Collection<Card> collection)
        Returns true if this pile contains at least one of each of the cards in the specified collection. Returns false if the specified collection is null.
        Parameters:
        collection - - collection whose cards are to be checked for containment in this pile
        Returns:
        true if this pile contains at least one of each of the cards in the specified collection

      • deleteAllOfType

        public boolean deleteAllOfType(Card card)
        Deletes all occurrences of the specified card from this pile, if present. If this pile does not contain the card, it is unchanged. Returns true if this pile changed as a result of the call.
        Parameters:
        card - - card to be deleted from this pile, if present
        Returns:
        true if this pile changed as a result of the call

      • deleteAllOfTypes

        public boolean deleteAllOfTypes(java.util.Collection<Card> collection)
        Deletes from this pile all of its cards that appear at least once in the specified collection. If this pile does not contain any of the cards, it is unchanged. Returns true if this pile changed as a result of the call.
        Parameters:
        collection - - collection containing cards to be deleted from this pile, if present
        Returns:
        true if this pile changed as a result of the call

      • deleteHighestOfType

        public boolean deleteHighestOfType(Card card)
        Deletes the uppermost occurrence of the specified card from this pile, if present. If this pile does not contain the card, it is unchanged. Returns true if this pile changed as a result of the call.
        Parameters:
        card - - card to be deleted from this pile, if present
        Returns:
        true if this pile changed as a result of the call

      • deleteLowestOfType

        public boolean deleteLowestOfType(Card card)
        Deletes the lowermost occurrence of the specified card from this pile, if present. If this pile does not contain the card, it is unchanged. Returns true if this pile changed as a result of the call.
        Parameters:
        card - - card to be deleted from this pile, if present
        Returns:
        true if this pile changed as a result of the call

      • getCard

        public Card getCard()
        Returns a reference to the card at the top of this pile. Changes to the returned card are reflected in this pile, and vice-versa.

        A deep copy of the returned card can be obtained by calling Card.copy() on the returned card.

        Returns:
        a reference to the card at the top of this pile
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if this pile is empty (size() == 0)

      • getCardAt

        public Card getCardAt(int index)
        Returns a reference to the card at the specified position in this pile. Changes to the returned card are reflected in this pile, and vice-versa.

        An index greater than or equal to the size of this pile returns the top card. An index less than or equal to the negative of the size of this pile returns the bottom card. Any other negative index specifies the position from the top of this pile.

        A deep copy of the returned card can be obtained by calling Card.copy() on the returned card.

        Parameters:
        index - - index of the card to return
        Returns:
        a reference to the card at the specified position in this pile
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if this pile is empty (size() == 0)
        See Also:
        wrapIndex(int, boolean)

      • getCards

        public Pile getCards(int quantity)
        Returns a pile containing references to the specified quantity of cards from the top of this pile. Non-structural changes in the returned pile are reflected in this pile, and vice-versa. If the specified quantity is greater than or equal to the size of this pile, a copy of this pile is returned.

        A deep copy of the returned pile can be obtained by calling copy() on the returned pile.

        Parameters:
        quantity - - number of cards to return
        Returns:
        a pile containing references to the specified quantity of cards from the top of this pile
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if quantity is negative (quantity < 0)

      • getCardsAt

        public Pile getCardsAt(int index,
                       int quantity)
        Returns a pile containing references to the specified quantity of cards from the specified position in this pile. This pile is unchanged. Non-structural changes in the returned pile are reflected in this pile, and vice-versa. If the sum of the specified index and quantity is greater than or equal to the size of this pile, the card at the specified index and all cards above it are returned.

        An index greater than or equal to the size of this pile returns the top card. An index less than or equal to the negative of the size of this pile returns the specified quantity of cards from the bottom of this pile. Any other negative index specifies the position from the top of this pile.

        A deep copy of the returned pile can be obtained by calling copy() on the returned pile.

        Parameters:
        index - - index of the first card to be returned
        quantity - - number of cards to return
        Returns:
        a pile containing references to the specified quantity of cards from the specified position in this pile
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if quantity is negative (quantity < 0)
        See Also:
        wrapIndex(int, boolean)

      • highestIndexOf

        public int highestIndexOf(Card card)
        Returns the index of the uppermost occurrence of the specified card in this pile, or -1 if this pile does not contain the card.
        Parameters:
        card - - card for which to search
        Returns:
        the index of the uppermost occurrence of the specified card in this pile, or -1 if this pile does not contain the card

      • highestIndexOf

        public int highestIndexOf(Card card,
                          int fromIndex)
        Returns the index of the uppermost occurrence of the specified card in this pile, searching downwards from fromIndex, exclusive; or -1 if this pile does not contain the card.

        A fromIndex greater than or equal to the size of this pile causes the search to be performed over the entire pile. A fromIndex less than or equal to the negative of the size of this pile causes the search to be performed over an empty pile and returns -1. Any other negative fromIndex specifies the position from the top of this pile.

        Parameters:
        card - - card for which to search
        fromIndex - - index before which to start the search
        Returns:
        the index of the uppermost occurrence of the specified card in this pile, searching downwards from fromIndex, exclusive; or -1 if this pile does not contain the card
        See Also:
        wrapIndex(int, boolean)

      • lowestIndexOf

        public int lowestIndexOf(Card card)
        Returns the index of the lowermost occurrence of the specified card in this pile, or -1 if this pile does not contain the card.
        Parameters:
        card - - card for which to search
        Returns:
        the index of the lowermost occurrence of the specified card in this pile, or -1 if this pile does not contain the card

      • lowestIndexOf

        public int lowestIndexOf(Card card,
                         int fromIndex)
        Returns the index of the lowermost occurrence of the specified card in this pile, searching upwards from fromIndex, inclusive; or -1 if this pile does not contain the card.

        A fromIndex greater than or equal to the size of this pile causes the search to be performed over an empty pile and returns -1. A fromIndex less than or equal to the negative of the size of this pile causes the search to be performed over the entire pile. Any other negative fromIndex specifies the position from the top of this pile.

        Parameters:
        card - - card for which to search
        fromIndex - - index at which to start the search
        Returns:
        the index of the lowermost occurrence of the specified card in this pile, searching upwards from fromIndex, inclusive; or -1 if this pile does not contain the card
        See Also:
        wrapIndex(int, boolean)

      • pickCard

        public Card pickCard()
        Make it so!

        Removes a card from the top of this pile.

        Returns:
        the card that was removed from this pile
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if this pile is empty (size() == 0)

      • pickCardAt

        public Card pickCardAt(int index)
        Removes a card from the specified position in this pile. Lowers any cards above it (subtracts one from their indices).

        An index greater than or equal to the size of this pile causes the top card to be removed from this pile. An index less than or equal to the negative of the size of this pile causes the bottom card to be removed from this pile. Any other negative index specifies the position from the top of this pile.

        Parameters:
        index - - index of the card to be removed
        Returns:
        the card that was removed from this pile
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if this pile is empty (size() == 0)
        See Also:
        wrapIndex(int, boolean)

      • pickCards

        public Pile pickCards(int quantity)
        Make them so!

        Removes the specified quantity of cards from the top of this pile. If the specified quantity is greater than or equal to the size of this pile, a copy of this pile is returned and the original is emptied.

        Parameters:
        quantity - - number of cards to remove
        Returns:
        a pile containing the cards that were removed from this pile
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if quantity is negative (quantity < 0)

      • pickCardsAt

        public Pile pickCardsAt(int index,
                        int quantity)
        Removes the specified quantity of cards from the specified position in this pile. Lowers any cards above them (decreases their indices). If the sum of the specified index and quantity is greater than or equal to the size of this pile, the card at the specified index and all cards above it are removed.

        An index greater than or equal to the size of this pile causes the top card to be removed from this pile. An index less than or equal to the negative of the size of this pile causes the specified quantity of cards to be removed from the bottom of this pile. Any other negative index specifies the position from the top of this pile.

        Parameters:
        index - - index of the first card to be removed
        quantity - - number of cards to remove
        Returns:
        a pile containing the cards that were removed from this pile
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if quantity is negative (quantity < 0)
        See Also:
        wrapIndex(int, boolean)

      • copy

        public Pile copy()
        Returns a deep copy of this pile. Null cards in this pile will be copied to the returned pile.

        A pile contains an ArrayList of mutable Card objects. Each card in this pile is copied and added to a new list. A new pile is constructed from this list and returned. Since a shallow copy of a card functions the same as a deep copy, the returned pile is a deep copy of this pile. Changes to the returned pile will not be reflected in this pile, nor will changes to this pile be reflected in the returned pile.

        Returns:
        a deep copy of this instance of the Pile class
        See Also:
        Card, Card.copy()

      • reverse

        public void reverse()
        Reverses the order of the cards in this pile.
        See Also:
        Collections.reverse(java.util.List)

      • setFaceUp

        public void setFaceUp(boolean faceUp)
        Sets the face visibility of the cards in this pile to the specified state.
        Parameters:
        faceUp - - whether the faces of the cards in this pile should be visible

      • shuffle

        public void shuffle()
        Shuffles this pile. Randomly permutes this pile using a default source of randomness. All permutations occur with approximately equal likelihood.
        See Also:
        Collections.shuffle(java.util.List)

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the number of cards in this pile.
        Returns:
        the number of cards in this pile

      • sort

        public void sort(CardComparator comparator)
        Sorts this pile according to the order induced by the specified comparator. This sort is guaranteed to be stable: equal cards will not be reordered as a result of the sort.
        Parameters:
        comparator - - the comparator to determine the order of the pile
        See Also:
        Collections.sort(java.util.List, java.util.Comparator), CardComparator

      • toggleFaceUp

        public void toggleFaceUp()
        Toggles the face visibility of the cards in this pile. Cards that are face up will be turned face down, and cards that are face down will be turned face up.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this pile. This is a formatted string containing the number of cards in this pile and the string representation of each card. Each card appears on a new line with its index. Cards are appended in reverse order so that cards at the top of a pile appear at the top of the list.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of this pile.
        See Also:
        Card.toString()

      • getList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Card> getList()
        Exposes the ArrayList of Card objects wrapped by this instance of the Pile class.
        Returns:
        the ArrayList of Card objects wrapped by this instance of the Pile class
